Sentencas: CO2-poisoning is a severe issue for the cathode materials of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) as even a tiny amount of CO2 in ambient atmosphere can cause dramatic electrochemical performance degradation.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to minimize the poisoning effect, Ba-/Sr-free oxides are explored so that the basicity of the cathode materials can be substantially reduced.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, Ca-doped LaCoO3-delta and LaCoO(3-delta )oxides are investigated as a feasible solution.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The Co and Fe based perovskites show high electrical conductivities, e.g. 1036.8 and 163.3 Scm(-1) measured at 750 degrees C for La0.6Ca0.4FeO3-delta (LCCo) and La0.6Ca0.4FeO3-delta (LCFe), respectively.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: LCFe exhibits better thermal compatibility with the electrolyte due to its relatively lower thermal expansion coefficient (12.86 x 10(-6) K-1) than LCCo (17.44 x 10(-6) K-1).
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Meanwhile, LCFe shows better CO2 tolerance.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Simultaneously, LCFe based cathode shows much high electrochemical performance, e.g. 0.078 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C and very stable performance in 10% CO2-air atmosphere.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For further understanding the CO2 tolerance of LCFe, density functional theory calculations are performed to reveal the mechanism of CO2 adsorption on the surface, suggesting a potential Ca-doping strategy for designing and optimizing cathode materials for SOFCs.
Titulo: Understanding the favorable CO2 tolerance of Ca-doped LaFeO3 perovskite cathode for solid oxide fuel cells
